src:
Trinkijeri pred Veneciju: Imaju 120 uigranih akcija, moramo da idemo na veći broj poseda
Italijanski stručnjak nije želeo da precizira kada bi na terenu mogao da se pojavi Bel

04 Nov 2019

Partizan odlično igra u dosadašnjem delu sezone u Evrokupu. Crno-beli do sada nisu upisali nijedan poraz i stoga sa velikim samopouzdanjem dočekuju ekipu Venecije, međutim kako sami kažu, ne očekuju nimalo laku utakmicu, koja će biti umnogome drugačija u odnosu na onu viđenu u Italiji.



Tako trener Beograđana, Andrea Trinkijeri, tvrdi da će njegov tim pokušati da igra na veći broj poseda i da tako slomi Italijane.„Dug im je roster, šuterski su tim. Zajedno su već pet godina, osvojili su dve titule u Italiji. Znamo koliko moramo da budemo dobri, biće to teška utakmica. Toliko su dugo skupa da mislim da imaju skoro 120 uigranih akcija, tako da moramo da odiramo energično i čvrsto u odbrani protiv šutera, možda malo i da podignemo ritam. Znam da je to donekle i teško, jer smo umorni posle puno putovanja i treninga, ali moramo pokušati da igramo na veći broj poseda“, izjavio je strateg crno-belih.
Italijan je istakao da će sutrašnji meč jedino propustiti Kori Volden, dok o najnovijem pojačanju, Belu, nije previše želeo da govori.„Kad bude spreman zaigraće. Ekipa kad se takmiči je kao autobus, kreće se. Tako da ako želiš, moraš da trčiš da uhvatiš autobus. Ja ne znam kada bi to moglo da se desi“, zaključio je Trinkijeri.
Reč o utakmici dao je i Vil Mozli, koji je veliki deo karijere proveo upravo igrajući na Apeninskom poluostrvu.„Naredna utakmica sa Venecijom će biti izuzetno teška. Iako smo se već jednom sastali sa njima, imamo dosta respekta i vredno se pripremamo za ovaj meč. Znamo da će doći na ovaj meč puni samopouzdanja i spremni za borbu. Igrao sam u Italiji veći deo svoje karijere, znam dosta njihovih igrača. Trenutno se nalaze u situaciji da moraju da idu na pobedu, tako da će sigurno biti dosta teže“, rekao je Mozli.




Foto: 
MN Press
text:
Trinkies before Venice: They have 120 games played, we need to go for more possessions
An Italian expert did not want to specify when Bel could appear on the field

04 Nov 2019

Partizan have been playing well in the Eurocup season so far. The Black and Whites have not recorded a single defeat so far and therefore are very confident in welcoming the Venice team, however, as they say, they do not expect a very easy game, which will be much different from the one seen in Italy.



Thus, Belgrade coach Andrea Trinkieri claims that his team will try to play on more possessions and thus break the Italians. "They are a long roster, they are a shooting team. They have been together for five years, winning two titles in Italy. We know how good we have to be, it's going to be a tough game. They are so expensive that I think they have almost 120 action games, so we have to go vigorously and firmly in defense against the shooter, maybe even raise the pace a little. I know it is somewhat difficult because we are tired after a lot of travel and training, but we have to try to play on more possessions, "said the black and white strategist.
The Italian pointed out that tomorrow's match would only be missed by Kori Volden, while he did not want to talk too much about Bel's latest reinforcement. "When he is ready to play. The team when competing is like a bus, moving. So if you want to, you have to run to catch the bus. I don't know when that might happen, "Trinkieri concluded.
Will Mozley, who spent much of his career playing in the Apennine Peninsula, also spoke about the match. "The next match with Venice will be extremely difficult. Although we have met with them once before, we have a lot of respect and are well prepared for this match. We know that they will come to this match with confidence and ready to fight. I have played in Italy for most of my career, I know a lot of their players. Right now, they are in a situation where they have to go for the win, so it will certainly be a lot harder, "said Mozley.

MN Press
